content.description:
Climb the finger crack and stem (dihedral) to a pretty impressive but easily surmountable roof.  Some belay anchors at the top and a rappel station off the backside of Gorilla rock complete the circuit.

A yellow (#2, BD) fits nicely in the lip of the roof.
Head up into the chimney/gulley on dirty rock. The crux is a very tight squeeze to exit the chimney. The move is easy enough with good hands, but it is tight.
content.location: On the north side of the rock. This is the leftmost crack/chimney.

content.description:
Face climb around the right crack. Good lead, easy topropable by pulling through the only 5.6 (a bit awkward) move in a chimney on a North side of the rock.

Rappel to the North from rappel rings left to TR South side anchor.
content.protection: Smaller is better. Brass (small) nuts and a couple of fingers to thin hands size cams.

content.description: The punchline to the route name is only an ant could climb the "crack" for most of this line... though it opens up and takes fingers or toes at the very end. The crux moves are face and use smearing. Start by attaining a ledge low on the face. Walk it left (past Ant Crack, Right) to the next fracture. Work up the crack line, using things on the face, resting at the occasional tiny Phantom Spires Patented Knob. When the crack opens enough to take finger tips near the finish, the going gets easy.
content.protection: Normally toproped after leading Ko-Ko Box to the shared anchors on top of Gorilla Rock. I rated it 5.8 R as a trad lead, since there is no pro until two thirds of the way up; then micro nuts and small cams protect well to the top.
content.location: Facing south on Gorilla Rock, right of Ko-Ko Box. Both Ant Cracks start with the same move, then split left or right at the first ledge.
